instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2796: What is 820-2796? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Ts0P and SMC PID??????HELP PLEASE
threads.message: I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no liquid, no drop damage. Runs sluggish and Throws Ts0P error ( I know usually track pad sensor). The SMC PID doesn't ring a bell... Anyone have any idea what it is and where I should start? Fan runs high, and machine is sluggish.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Ts0P and SMC PID??????HELP PLEASE
threads.message: As you said, trackpad/cable/connector. And yes it will be corrosion in the connector

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Ts0P and SMC PID??????HELP PLEASE
threads.message: @dukefawks... No corrosion, but I think I will switch it out anyway... does the SMC PID trip too if the Ts0P trips?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Ts0P and SMC PID??????HELP PLEASE
threads.message: @dukefawks... No corrosion, but I think I will switch it out anyway... does the SMC PID trip too if the Ts0P trips?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Ts0P and SMC PID??????HELP PLEASE
threads.message: Pin 8 and 9 are data to the thermal sensor. Measure if they make it from the board to the trackpad.
